subject: Marketing
title: The Sleeper Effect
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Sleeper Effect.

hook.text: A low-credibility source delivers a claim. You dismiss it. Weeks later, you believe it.

buildup.text: Over time, the brain disconnects the message from the messenger.

discovery.text: This is the sleeper effect: persuasion that strengthens after the source is forgotten.

twist.text: Even propaganda you rejected can shape your beliefs months later.

climax.text: Researchers found the effect peaks around six weeks after initial exposure.

punchline.text: Dismissed messages don't always stay dismissed.

quiz.question: What happens during the sleeper effect?
options: A dismissed message becomes more persuasive over time
People fall asleep during boring advertisements
Repeated exposure makes ads less effective
